result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian A. Shoemaker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine paid in full from bond on file.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian A. Shoemaker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DNA submission form
DNA submission form.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney White.  Defendant pleading to an amended Count 1, Poss THC 1st.  Count 4 amended from Resisting to Obstructing.  Defendant plead no contest.  Counts 2 and 3 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the charge he is pleading to.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Court confirmed defendant's prior conviction.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  Finds that a factual basis exists.  Found guilty as plead to.  Joint recommendation for fine.  $75.00, plus costs, each count.  Defendant elected to exercise his right to allocution.  Court adopted the joint recommendation.  $75.00 fine, plus costs.  Total $965.88.  20DTP.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. Not to possess any firearm's.  Jackson County Sheriff's Dept is to accompany him to retrieve all his firearm's and take into their possession.
Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Sig bond set and return date given.
